a1: An XML sitemap is a file that lists all important URLs on your website, helping search engines discover and index your content more efficiently.
q2: How many URLs can a sitemap have?
a2: A single sitemap can contain up to 50,000 URLs and must not exceed 50MB uncompressed. For larger sites, use a sitemap index file.
q3: How often should I update my sitemap?
a3: Update your sitemap whenever you add, remove, or significantly change pages on your website. For dynamic sites, automated generation is recommended.
